intro: This section allows you to manage your RTMP settings and control your live stream. Here you can copy your server URL, stream key, and more.
Click here to copy your RTMP server URL to the clipboard. You'll need this URL to set up your stream in broadcasting software like OBS.
Click here to copy your stream key to the clipboard. This is required by your broadcasting software to identify your stream.
This combines both the server URL and stream key into one string. Click here to copy both to the clipboard for easy setup.

Click here to view recommended settings for optimal streaming performance, including video resolution, bitrate, and audio specifications. Following these guidelines helps ensure a high-quality, buffer-free live streaming experience.
In this tab, you can configure your stream metadata, including the title, password protection, images, user groups and stream listing.
You can change your live title here.
You can change your live category here.
You can password-protect your live stream by entering a password here. Only users with the password will be able to watch.
Use this field to add a description for your live stream. This description will be displayed to your viewers.
Toggle this switch to make your stream publicly listed. If disabled, the stream will not appear in public listings.
After setting your stream metadata, click here to save your changes.
In this tab, you can add custom images in your live.
In this tab, you can control which user groups are allowed to view your stream. Uncheck all to make it public, or select groups to limit access.
